Posted By: GengilOrbios (10/21/2010 8:02:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Nowadays that we have Jund and Golgari, getting to sacrifice a creature every turn can actually be quite an *advantage*. Plus, you get a giant flying, trampling 7/7 demon. I know that it's not the best card (Or even close to Akroma's equal), but I think it deserves a better rating than it has right now (the new art alone is worth 3 stars!). And at least when he deals 7 to you, he doesn't tap like some other demons.  
  
Try him with [Dragon Appeasement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Appeasement) and [Golgari Germination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Germination) for some fun. :)
posts.html:

I know that it's not the best card (Or even close to Akroma's equal), but I think it deserves a better rating than it has right now (the new art alone is worth 3 stars!). And at least when he deals 7 to you, he doesn't tap like some other demons.

Try him with Dragon Appeasement and Golgari Germination for some fun. :)

Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (8/19/2011 10:52:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
There is only one Lord, and this is He.  
  
There was a time when trading a Mox Pearl for this bad boy made sense, if you didn't like playing white. Man, how the years have flown by.  
  
And this printing is quite an upgrade. Thumbs up. The new Oracle wording is clearer (dear god did we ever have the fights over whether Lord of the Pit could eat itself, back then. Check the [old wording](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=365) to see why.) The new art is stellar (going with Chippy was a fantastic choice for Lord's revival, his artwork for Abyssal Persecutor is awesome). The new flavor text is *perfect*. Heck, even the expansion symbol looks cool on this guy.  
  
Lord of the Pit's one of five Beta creatures to become immediately and enduringly iconic (Lord of the Pit, [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=566), [Shivan Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=517), [Gaea's Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=447), and [Tim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=416)), and kudos to Wiz... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
There is only one Lord, and this is He.

There was a time when trading a Mox Pearl for this bad boy made sense, if you didn't like playing white. Man, how the years have flown by.

And this printing is quite an upgrade. Thumbs up. The new Oracle wording is clearer (dear god did we ever have the fights over whether Lord of the Pit could eat itself, back then. Check the old wording to see why.) The new art is stellar (going with Chippy was a fantastic choice for Lord's revival, his artwork for Abyssal Persecutor is awesome). The new flavor text is perfect. Heck, even the expansion symbol looks cool on this guy.

Lord of the Pit's one of five Beta creatures to become immediately and enduringly iconic (Lord of the Pit, Serra Angel, Shivan Dragon, Gaea's Liege, and Tim), and kudos to Wiz... (see all)

Rating:

posts.post_content:
How often does the flavor text talk to the player personally?  
It's a bit intimidating, honestly. I like it.  
  
I find it a bit sad that he can't grapple with a particularly large squid, or scaled wurm. It seems like he should be able to do that, what with all the flavorful power.  
I guess it just puts Emrakul in perspective though. Emrakul could take on two of these guys at the same time, even though it would be a tough fight.
